definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: But you get up, brush yourself off and get on the saddle again.
sentences.chinese: 但是你又爬起来，掸去身上的尘土，再次爬上车座。

sentences.english: Look, there are lots of rice on you clothes. Let mommy take them off.
sentences.chinese: 看，你的衣服上都是饭，妈妈给你把它们掸下去。

sentences.english: She have an allergy to household dust.
Her hand brushed a speck of lint from her skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她的手掸掉衣裙上的一点棉花絮。

sentences.english: She dusted the furniture with a duster.
sentences.chinese: 她用掸子掸掉家具上的灰尘。

sentences.english: The woman brushed herself off. She pulled herself together and went downstairs for dinner with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她掸了掸灰，定了定神，便来到楼下与丈夫一起用餐。

sentences.english: The woman brushed herself off. She pulled herself together and went downstairs for dinner with her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她掸了掸灰，定了定神，便来到楼下与丈夫一起用餐。

sentences.english: I come from Tangshan city, Hebei Province.
sentences.chinese: 我来自特性掸人城市，河北省。

sentences.english: She was dusting down the furniture.
sentences.chinese: 她正在掸去家具上的灰尘。

sentences.english: Those old dusters will become useful for polishing the car.
sentences.chinese: 那些旧掸子来掸汽车上的灰倒挺合用的。

sentences.english: The teacher beat chalk dust from erasers.
sentences.chinese: 老师掸掉黑板擦上的粉笔灰。

sentences.english: Please help me to sweep the dust on my back.
sentences.chinese: 请帮我掸一下我后背的尘土。

sentences.english: He wiped the dust off and gently wrapped it in brown paper.
sentences.chinese: 他掸去灰尘，用棕色厚纸把东西小心包好。

sentences.english: She dusted off her bed and lay down.
sentences.chinese: 她掸干净床，然后躺在床上休息。

sentences.english: She dusted all the books on the bookshelf.
sentences.chinese: 她把书架上所有书上的灰尘都掸干净。

definition: the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)
to hold sth long and run one's hand along it
to smooth or arrange sth using one's fingers/to stroke
to moisten/to be infected by/to receive benefit or advantage through a contact/to touch
muddy/covered in (mud, dust, sweat, blood etc)/daubed in
